|chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = U.FL |antenna = |txchains = 3 |rxchains = 3 |sstreams = 3 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |802.11n = 450/450 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = VoxMicro |manuf_model = AEX-AR9590-NI |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = industrial-grade |802dot11_protocols = abgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 2013 |estprice = 69.95 |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B00OJPJUIA |asin_country = JP |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = Taiwan |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== [[Atheros]] Reference Design XB116 (QCA, P/N AR5BXB116) :[[Atheros]] AR9590-AL1B chipset (codename ''Peacock'') :3T3R Mini PCIe Wi-Fi Adapter Card :Dual Band 802.11abgn (up to 450Mbps) :High Power 24dbm (200mW) MIMO 3x3 According to the [https://fccid.io/2AE3B-AEX-AR95X/Letter/Cover-Letters-20170602-v1-Family-model-declaration-letter-3459872 Family model declaration letter] on the FCC, :the following models are based on identical code design: * AEX-AR95X * AEX-AR9580-NX * AEX-AR9590-NX * AEX-AR9590-NI * AEX-AR9590-NIB ==Notes== {{SCollapse|PCI ID • [https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/Documentation/devicetree/bindings/net/wireless/qca%2Cath9k.txt GitHub] • hostapd • >> . |

Linux based AP using hostapd:

Wiphy phy0
max # scan SSIDs: 4
max scan IEs length: 2257 bytes
Retry short limit: 7
Retry long limit: 4
Coverage class: 0 (up to 0m)
Device supports RSN-IBSS.
Device supports AP-side u-APSD.
Device supports T-DLS.
Supported Ciphers:
* WEP40 (00-0f-ac:1)
* WEP104 (00-0f-ac:5)
* TKIP (00-0f-ac:2)
* CCMP (00-0f-ac:4)
* CMAC (00-0f-ac:6)
Available Antennas: TX 0x7 RX 0x7
Configured Antennas: TX 0x7 RX 0x7
Supported interface modes:
* IBSS
* managed
* AP
* AP/VLAN
* WDS
* monitor
* mesh point
* P2P-client
* P2P-GO
Band 1:
Capabilities: 0x11ef
RX LDPC
HT20/HT40
SM Power Save disabled
RX HT20 SGI
RX HT40 SGI
TX STBC
RX STBC 1-stream

DSSS/CCK HT40

HT TX/RX MCS rate indexes supported: 0-23

Supported commands:
* new_interface
* set_interface
* new_key
* start_ap
* new_station
* new_mpath
* set_mesh_config
* set_bss
* authenticate
* associate
* deauthenticate
* disassociate
* join_ibss
* join_mesh

* set_noack_map

* start_p2p_device
* set_mcast_rate
* Unknown command (104)
* connect
* disconnect
Supported TX frame types:
* IBSS: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
* managed: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
* AP: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
* AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
* mesh point: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
* P2P-client: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
* P2P-GO: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
* P2P-device: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
Supported RX frame types:
* IBSS: 0x40 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
* managed: 0x40 0xd0
* AP: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
* AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
* mesh point: 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
* P2P-client: 0x40 0xd0
* P2P-GO: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
* P2P-device: 0x40 0xd0
software interface modes (can always be added):
* AP/VLAN
* monitor
valid interface combinations:
* #{ managed } <= 2048, #{ AP, mesh point } <= 8, #{ P2P-client, P2P-GO } <= 1,
total <= 2048, #channels <= 1, STA/AP BI must match
* #{ WDS } <= 2048,
total <= 2048, #channels <= 1, STA/AP BI must match
HT Capability overrides:
* MCS: ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff
* maximum A-MSDU length
* supported channel width
* short GI for 40 MHz
* max A-MPDU length exponent
* min MPDU start spacing
Device supports TX status socket option.
Device supports HT-IBSS.
Device supports SAE with AUTHENTICATE command
Device supports low priority scan.
Device supports scan flush.
Device supports AP scan.
Device supports per-vif TX power setting
Driver supports a userspace MPM
Device supports active monitor (which will ACK incoming frames)
Driver/device bandwidth changes during BSS lifetime (AP/GO mode)
}} ==See also== *[[AIRETOS AEX-QCA9880-NX]] - 802.11abgn/ac 3T3R Dual Band WLAN Module, :QCA9880, Extended Temperature Grade, Full Size Mini PCI Express Module *[[AIRETOS AEH-AR9462-LC]] - 802.11abgn Dual Band Combo WiFi & BT 4.0 Module, :[[Atheros]] AR9462 chipset - WB222 (AR5B22), 2T2R Mini PCIe Half-Size Module *[[AIRETOS AEH-AR9485-NC]] - 802.11bgn 1T2R WiFi Mini PCIe Half-Size Module, :[[Atheros]] AR9485 chipset - Reference Design HB125 (AR5B125) [[Category:English Documentation]]
